H0.text: who brought the idea of castles to england. Viking Settlers

H1.text: who brought the idea of castles to england. Roman Legions

H2.text: who brought the idea of castles to england. Anglo-Saxon Kings

H3.text: who brought the idea of castles to england. Norman invaders

A4.text: During the 12th century the Normans began to build more castles in stone – with characteristic square keep – that played both military and political roles.

A5.text: The Normans began to build motte and bailey and ringwork castles in large numbers to control their newly occupied territories in England and the Welsh Marches.
